titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the percentage of completion method of accounting shall not be required to be used with respect to contracts for the manufacture of property if no payments are required to be made before the completion of the manufacture of such property.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that the use of the percentage of completion method of accounting is not required with respect to contracts for the manufacture of property if no payments are required to be made before the completion of the manufacture of such property.
